review_title: USN Nursing Program Headed for Failure!
job_title: Assistant Professor
pros: Very new, nice looking campus, offices, supplies and classrooms. There is no tenure system and the university is privately owned. The university's philosophy is student-focused and the curriculum is cutting edge using a Block System. If you are in the Pharmacy program life is good because of the good leadership.
cons: The College of Nursing - Dean and Assistant Dean provide incompetent leadership. Therefore, some faculty are hard working and dedicated to the school's success but some faculty are incompent and do not contribute. Some faculty are favored over others and get treated better than the others. This situation is incredibly frustrating to those who are great teachers and hard workers, but not rewarded. Otherwise it could be a great place to work and the program a huge success.

review_title: Not the best place to work.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in South Jordan, UT
pros: Good vacation and sick time-but if you use it, you are treated poorly.  You hardly ever work on the weekends, which is nice.
cons: Employees are not treated equally.  There is a lot of unfairness in the company and the immediate supervisors I worked for created a hostile work environment.  The school is growing too quickly and budgets are getting cut.  The health insurance was changed midyear to save them money and it hurt a lot of employees.  No raises for several years now due to growth.  HR is not good. After years they finally got rid of the main person who sexually harassed many of the females.  Now one person is split between two campuses for HR.  I do not recommend this employer.

job_title: Library Assistant in Henderson, NV
pros: People are nice, the facility is clean, if the library (where I work) is closed on a day that I am regularly scheduled to work I still get paid.
cons: Recruitment is long. You only email your cover letter and resume, but you don't fill out the job application until AFTER they offer you get the job, so they have something on file, I suppose.

review_title: Roseman is a good place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Henderson, NV
pros: The pros of Roseman University is they have the block system, students are very much a part of the curriculum. The university seeks students opinions to make the curriculum better. Good pay, good work hours, no micromanaging from the dean.
cons:
Changing the curriculum without complete faculty buy in
Has been some instances of incivility, but we have a faculty member over these problems

review_title: Great job and great place to work
job_title: Library Assistant in Henderson, NV
pros: Great starting pay, great schedule and supervisor is willing to work my schedule, vacation and sick time are accrued quickly, coworkers and supervisors are wonderful to work with, supervisor very understanding when a family emergency came up
cons: It is very slow but there are tasks that can keep you busy, plus after a few weeks you get projects to work on

job_title: Tech Services Project Coordinator in Henderson, NV
pros: Wonderful friendly atmosphere, great time off, understanding of sick/family leave and good benefits.
cons: Don't have anything negative to say, but because it is mandatory to complete this review guess I'd add that like many other companies there has been little pay increase or promotions over the past few years due to economy and growth.

job_title: Help Desk in South Jordan, UT
pros: The atmosphere at the South Jordan, UT campus is very relaxed and the faculty and staff are all very friendly.
cons: The Henderson, NV campus is much more cut throat and I wouldn't work there.

job_title: Staff
pros: Great people to work with both faculty and staff, friendly environment and good management. Generous vacation time and decent benefits.
cons: lack of regular annual pay raises.
